CatDescriptText: Cutline of images published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 30, 1952, pg. 21 reads: "Tee with UGA - Some of the nation's top golfers are gathered in Pittsburgh this week for the annual UGA Golf Tournament conducted over the beautiful course at South Park...of the pictorial highlights are shown above. Upper left, Willie Brown Jr., sensational 19-year-old Houston, Tex.,...shows the form that has earned him the title of ...longest hitting amateur in country.  Willie beat Joe Louis in the first round.  Below: Willie and a group of glamorous spectators who stopped watching the matches long enough to turn on their effervescent smiles for our camera.  The ladies are, left to right, Mrs. Joseph Washington, Pittsburgh; Mrs. Ada Jordan, Chicago, Ill,; Mrs. Barbara Reed, Los Angeles, Calif.; and Mrs. Evelyn Watkins, Dayton, Ohio.  Center photo show Chester Batey, dapper Chicago business man, at the wheel of his $8,000 Muntz Jet.  Others in the photo, left to right, are Booker Blair, Joe Roach and Stanley Garland.  Lower left photo shows another bevy of beauties gathered around the information table.  Left to right are Mrs. Frances Mars, Washington, D.C.; Mrs. Dorothy Young, Philadelphia, Pa.; Mrs. Marguerite Brown, Baltimore, Md.; Miss Marian Parsley, Cleveland, Ohio, and Mrs. Thelma Sales, Pittsburgh, Pa.  A group of the nation's hottest amateurs are shown in the upper right picture.  The players are, left to right, Bob Williams, Joe Louis, Eural Clark, Leonard Reed and Jerry Sumpter.  Lower right; Hank Thompson, star performer with the New York Giants, took time off to visit many of his golfing friends Tuesday.  He's shown with Joe Louis.  Thompson quite a golfer during the off season shooting in the low 80's - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of four women, left to right, Mrs. Joseph Washington, Ada Jordan, Barbara Reed, and Evelyn Watkins, seated on lawn of the South Park Golf Course for the annual UGA Golf Tournament
